title: Feedback loops: How nature gets its rhythms - Anje-Margriet Neutel

multiple-choice.question: What is the key element that makes feedback beneficial in the natural world?

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: It amplifies a particular effect or change

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on the ecosystem

options.label: D
options.text: It creates a new feedback loop

options.label: C

options.label: C

title: Should I stay or should I switch doors?

multiple-choice.question: In the 'Let's Make a Deal' game show, what is the probability that the car is behind the door initially chosen by the contestant?
If the contestant initially chooses door number 1 and Monty opens door number 2, which of the following is the probability that the car is behind door number 3?
What is the recommended strategy for the contestant to maximize their chances of winning the car?

options.label: B
options.text: Switch to the other unopened door

options.label: C
options.text: Open one of the doors and see what's behind it

options.label: D
options.text: Give up and leave the game

multiple-choice.question: If the contestant plays the game multiple times, what is the probability that they will win the car?

options.label: D
options.text: The probability is concentrated behind the other unopened door

options.label: A
options.text: The probability of winning is lower

options.label: B
options.text: The probability of winning is higher

options.label: C
options.text: The probability of winning stays the same

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The probability of the car being behind the door is equal to the probability of Monty opening it

options.label: C
options.text: The probability of the car being behind the door is multiplied by the probability of Monty opening it

options.label: D
options.text: The probability of the car being behind the door is divided by the probability of Monty opening it

title: The past, present and future of the bubonic plague - Sharon N. DeWitte

options.label: C

options.text: It spread quickly, but primarily through water and food contamination

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C
